abstract: Throughout the day, die-hard Raiders fans converged at Ricky's restaurant to drink to Al Davis's memory and at the team's practice facility.
snippet: Throughout the day, die-hard Raiders fans converged at Ricky's restaurant to drink to Al Davis's memory and at the team's practice facility.
lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. - In the back of Ricky's restaurant in San Leandro, the unofficial headquarters of Raider Nation, a booth was empty Saturday afternoon except for the memories on the tabletop: a Super Bowl XV program; a Raiders program from a Sept. 27, 1964 home game against the Kansas City Chiefs with Al Davis on the cover, stalking the sideline; the California license plate JST WN BBY; a Raider beer mug, a Raider helmet telephone and two pennants, one from the 1977 Super Bowl at the Rose Bowl.

headline.main: Fans Raise a Glass to Al Davis
